scripts.say: Port - Office
I was quietly working with Newcastle, who was seated on the couch.
She might be rather boring, but... she shouldn't have any trouble supporting my servant.
Why did Queen Elizabeth describe her as "boring"...?

options.content: Steal a furtive glance at Newcastle
Don't do anything, like a wimp

scripts.say: Newcastle was silently flipping through operation reports.
Phew...
In the silence of the office, I could hear every gentle breath that escaped from her lips.

options.content: Try playing a prank on her

scripts.say: Terribly curious as to how she would react, I decided to play a little prank on Newcastle.
I tore a small piece off the eraser in my hand and flicked it in front of her.
Newcastle paused for a moment, but then resumed looking over her documents as if nothing even happened.
Unsatisfied, I decided to try again, but she shrugged off that attempt as well. I tried to get her attention in a variety of other ways, but failed each time.
Fine... Drastic times call for drastic measures...

options.content: Let's not do this after all...

scripts.say: I sneakily made my way behind the sofa and extended my fingers towards Newcastle's nape...
KABOOM!!
The sound of a loud explosion from the R&D Department tore through the office, sending me to my knees as my vision went black.
Commander, are you all right?
When I came to my senses, I found myself on top of Newcastle, my body pressed against hers.
I could feel a warm sensation pressing against my face...
Now, was this a happy little accident... or was this what you were aiming for all along?
You may stay there as long as you want... but you'll have to make up for it with overtime afterwards.
Her words were kind and mellow as always.
